algorithm.title: Optimization Algorithm
algorithm.description: Select the optimization strategy to find the optimal number of service channels
algorithm.label: Algorithm

binary_search.name: Binary Search
binary_search.description: Efficiently find minimum channels to meet target rejection probability

cost_minimization.name: Cost Minimization
cost_minimization.description: Balance channel costs against rejection penalties

gradient_descent.name: Gradient Descent
gradient_descent.info: Leave costs empty to minimize rejection probability only, or provide both to minimize total cost.

multi_objective.name: Multi-Objective Optimization
multi_objective.description: Balance rejection, utilization, and cost with custom weights

channelCost.label: Channel Cost
channelCost.description: Cost per channel per time unit
channelCost.descriptionOptional: Cost per channel (optional - leave empty to minimize rejection only)

rejectionPenalty.label: Rejection Penalty
rejectionPenalty.descriptionOptional: Penalty per rejection (optional - leave empty to minimize rejection only)

weights.title: Objective Weights
weights.description: Weights will be automatically normalized to sum to 1.0

baseRequest.title: Simulation Parameters
baseRequest.description: Base parameters used for optimization simulations

distributions.title: Process Distributions
distributions.description: Configure arrival and service process distributions

errors.title: Optimization Failed
errors.general: An error occurred during optimization. Please check your parameters and try again.

cost.title: Total Cost Analysis
cost.description: Total cost for the optimal configuration

convergence.title: Convergence History
convergence.showingFirst: Showing first {{shown}} of {{total}} iterations. Export CSV to see all results.

view.title: Channel Optimization
view.subtitle: Find the optimal number of service channels

info.title: Getting Started
info.description: Configure and run optimization algorithms to find the optimal number of service channels for your queueing system. Select an algorithm below to begin.
